Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: KRZ-Malta
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mostly for its location, within 5 mins of the Spanish Steps. Price was also reasonable. Rooms quite spacious but always kept way too hot. A couple of bulbs burst when switched on in room; free wifi is a nuisance as laptop / phone could not keep the password they provide so one needs to keep logging in user name and password; phone network is non existent in room so one needs to go outdoors if they need to use their mobile. Rooms look old but kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location; stay was great!”
Reviews.Author: krutec
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in May 2011. I am a little late posting this, but I wanted to offer some kind words about the great staff at the Hotel Internazionale. They were very helpful about everything and a pleasure to deal with. As for the hotel, it was a mid-level European hotel. The bed was very firm. It was getting to be rather warm in our room, but they say that is Rome in May. The location was amazing on Via Sistina just a few doors down from the Hotel Hassler at the top of the Spanish Steps. The subway station was only a block away, at the bottom of the Spanish Steps. There were some amazing restaurants within a 5 minute block (our hands down favorite was Enoteca Antica on Via della Croce). My wife found a wonderful leather shop nearby too. Our room included breakfast each morning....the buffet was a mixed bag, but better than I make for myself on the average day, so it was fine. Overall, the location made it a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Jane S
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in July for arrival the 3rd week of Oct 2011. They charged our AMEX for the full amt of our 4 nite stay.The first week of Oct, 2 weeks prior to our arrival, we were forced to cancel due to my husband having heart surgery.They refused to issue a refund and we were force to sek recovery from AMEX. We have been going to this hotel since the 1980s. NEVER AGAIN!.

Reviews.Title: “Old Italian charm”
Reviews.Author: JessEnrico
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (2 years and 5 months), although not the most child friendly layout we found the staff to be very accommodating and nothing was too much trouble. It is in a great location, close to the Spanish steps and not too far from the Trevi Fountain. The breakfast each morning was enjoyable and the staff in the breakfast room very friendly. If you are used to modern flashy rooms then this hotel is not for you, it has a great history and as mentioned above old Italian charm. We enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor quality in general”
Reviews.Author: Carannah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a double room for 1 week for business. It is a poor business hotel as the amenities are lacking and poor WiFi speeds. As a tourist Room and the hotel interior is dated (have character?). Room was not particularly clean, lack furnishings and in dire need of an update. One positive is the newly renovated fitness room on the 2nd floor. Service was average. A few more smiles here and there would have been appreciated. Breakfast had a good selection similar to other hotels in continental Europe but lacked the customary espresso/capuccino that most hotels/B&Bs offer in Italy. The hotel is nicely situated for a tourist who is in a hurry but for those that may have more time, I'd suggest heading out of the historical core and stay across the river Arno near the Ottaviano and Lepanto Metro stations as you will still have access to the Metro but will be staying where the Romans actually live and work. Originally scheduled to stay 2 weeks, I cut my stay at this particular hotel short and left to much better pastures. On this trip; I stayed at 3 different hotels in Rome and this hotel is definitely not worthy of another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: narracoa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location, very close to Spanish Steps, Spagna Metro and Barberini, and was quite nice. Breakfast was ok, nothing flash but all the basics. The issue I had with the hotel, were the walls were as thin as paper, and the beds are quite old and squeak - enough said, hard to get to sleep with someone next door enjoying the romance, and equally hard to get a good nights sleep on a squeaky bed. One other point, they offer a free welcome drink, but when I went to have it, I was told it is only served during 3-6pm - how welcoming, seeing that the bar is open after 6pm, and does not fit in well to a day of sightseeing - either offer a welcome drink or none at all. not something that an actuary has worked out no one will ever have : )

Reviews.Title: “absolutley fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: EddieKn
Reviews.Content: Nice location, great rooms with big balconies. Good breakfast but there should be more than one person working at the breakfast room. The staff are so kind and helpful. Great value of money compared to other hotels in rome. Overall it was a fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: LarsenCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Internazionale in Roma. It was a nice hotel, but the rooms were a bit damaged and old - but functional. The breakfast buffet and the staff was great. And they provided a great service and gave us a lot of tips for restaurants and so on. The location is very nice and close to the Spanis steps. But if you want top of the line hotel and modern rooms, don’t go there. Find a newly renovated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: EWGW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Internazionale for 4 nights. My first impression when I walked into the lobby was that it was run down as the carpeting was very worn and needed to be replaced. We were very tired as we had just traveled from Paris and Florence, so we tried not to judge the hotel had relaxed a little and until we saw our rooms. We were brought to our second room (the first did not have working air conditioning and was very dingy and worn) and were very disappointed. The carpeting again was very worn and did not look clean. The box mattress on the bed, which was not covered by a sheet or dust ruffle, was old, ripped, and not clean looking at all. The bathroom was also very dated. I'm not sure if we were just given the worst room in the hotel or if all of the rooms were like this. I am surprised to read that other guests were happy with their rooms. The people at the front desk were very helpful with issues we had with our airport transfers, but this was the only positive with the hotel. The pictures are not a true representation of what rooms are offered. We were very disappointed and do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: jnewlin1
Reviews.Content: Charming, old school but very clean. Best breakest and coffee. Excellent service, especially, Patricia, Gaitaino, and Antonio. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay, but better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Weloveflorence
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in the overall quality of the hotel. The bathroom constantly smelled like backed up sewage. The suite was large but the walls and floors seemed like they were due for renovation. Location was good right by Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kdpNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Rome that is in a good location and is also a good price is practically unheard of. Hotel Internazional is all that and more. At the top of the Spanish Steps and just steps from a Metro stop, it is a very comfortable hotel, well priced, with an incredible staff that is friendly, helpful, and professional. English is spoken and the staff is extremely helpful in assisting you with any questions about how to get around Rome and what to see. My husband and I were traveling with our 20-something son and booked a triple. The cot they placed in the room for him was small and extremely uncomfortable. When we mentioned this to the folks at the front desk, they moved us to a new room -- a double connected to a single -- that was perfect, with a terrace overlooking Via Sistina. The breakfast is in an elegant room and is quite extensive and good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone --- it's a great bargain and a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the chains...”
Reviews.Author: PeterJMDC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Internazionale offers a wonderful stay in a vividly historic section of Rome in a building that filled with hidden history. Rooms are definitely not your chain offering, and spring for a larger room - those with the courtyards are fabulous and offer good space for your teens. Elevator is a bit - okay extremely - small and you may need to take a couple trips if you brought a lot of luggage. Walking distance to 90% of what you'd want to see (Rome is a great walking city anyway). But the best restaurants, shopping, places for a cocktail and picture taking sites are all within a few hundred feet of your room. (Hint: for those with walking disabilities, there is an elevator just past the Spanish Steps to bring you down to the lower street.) (Hint 2: Sneak up to the rooftop with your beverage of choice some evening at sunset to watch the streets change into night mode.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: warsash
Reviews.Content: Clean large rooms. Friendly helpful staff with great tips for off the track restaurants. The location is great for exploring Rome with a young family and it provided and excellent base for us to set out on our adventures everyday. Highly recommend their transfer service from the airport. Good value friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tussi284
Reviews.Content: I love Rome and visited a million times before and this is one of the best hotels so far. At least from what we saw and experienced. We got a room that was quite big and spacious with our own little terrace. It was wonderful and perfect. The service at the hotel was great! We called down to the reception several times and they were all very helpful. The bathroom was also quite big. We didn't have anything to complain about. - No internet on the room. And then the location. It's the perfect location when in Rome. You live right above the Spanish Steps and everything is near. The area is of course very touristy, but what could you expect when you live right on top of the Spanish Steps? Very many and great Italian trattorias nearby with wonderful food. Yes, our stay was wonderful but I think we liked the hotel so much because of the terrace and that we got a great room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & wonderfully helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: TopsMA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Internazionale is feet away from the Spanish Steps, so a great location & close to the designer shops of Via Condotti & the metro! A quiet hotel with a small bar (unused by patrons as far as we could see), a computer with internet access & a very good breakfast each morning. The street was noisy in the morning if you have a room at the front of the hotel but the rooms, although simple, had the basics & were comfortable. The staff were excellent & incredibly helpful, booking Vatican & museum tickets for us as well as suggesting some excellent local restaurants. We took a walking tour, with Antiqua Tours, of the Forum & the Colosseum which was fantastic & I would highly recommend. Take a good pair of walking shoes to Rome, those cobbled streets are atmospheric but brutal on your feet!

Reviews.Title: “Four nights in Rome at charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rome090
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay In October 2010 at this hotel (spacious room, updated bathroom, beautiful blue tile, polite accommodating staff, great breakfast buffet and very professional steward who oversaw a usually well-filled room; concierges especially helpful). Great location atop the Spanish Steps and within easy reach of a gelato store. Our room was on the street side which was somewhat noisy, however, interesting and the fresh air very welcome. We only used taxis twice, Vatican and Borghese, which were available only a few feet away. I would definitely recommend the Internazionale for its services and convenient location).

Reviews.Title: “Good location - quiet hotel - good size room and bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: Golfergirl63
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location - near top of Spanish Steps and Metro stop. Very quiet hotel, pleasant staff, helped me get car service to airport. Breakfast was better than some of the other hotels we stayed at on our trip (has hot food). Room and bathroom bigger than average European hotel and bathroom was brand new. Private terrace overlooks garden in back of hotel! I thought it would overlook front - but I actually liked this better - very nice and good if you are with a smoker. Overall - pleasant and comfortable stay in quiet hotel in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, miniscule overprices rooms”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerTom
Reviews.Content: First time for me to stay on this hotel. It is located near the Spanish Steps, next door to Intercontinental and Hassler hotel. Probably that explains the price levels, as 250 Euro for a room was a bit too much. I had room 22 (try to avoid if like space), which was cramped to say the least. The room itself measures max 2.5 x 3m, and the bathroom is just a joke. Probably it is possible to take a shower whilst at the same time using the toilet! On a ferry ship the cabin is bigger. If you take into account the price you have to pay for this room, it probably makes sense to look at a little bit less convenient location. Rooms are outdated, but definitely have charm. The breakfast is excellent, with plenty of choice. Overall, if you really want to stay close to the Spanish steps and do not want to pay the rate of Intercontinental, this can be your choice. But trust me, there are other hotels with much better value/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pooe selection, overpriced, deserves the terrible rating.”
Reviews.Author: JGSwick
Reviews.Content: Looked at the last minute for a 2 night weekend hotel in Rome, convenient to the tourist sights. Travel agent found the internazionale. Located next to the best tourist hotels, the Hassler, and the Intercontinental de la Ville on Via Sistina at the Spanish Steps. How could I go wrong? I did. Very old, musty, poor AC, single room was extremely small, and the single bed was too small for a comfortable rest. The worse part is the last minute reservation was more than double the going rate for advance booking. Read all the other Trip Advisor reviews, They are "right on" Don't stay here at an overpriced rate. Great location, but is an etremely poor value. inattentive staff. One desk clerk to collect and return your key.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: Andynnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again this year and it was another good stay. The staff is friendly - Gaetano in the breakfast room was a nice addition - the rooms are decent, and the location can't be beat. We had a nice room with a small patio covered in wisteria. The only concerns were the A/C not working to US standards (typical for Europe), the floors were so filthy in the room we had to wear the slippers provided, the tub wouldn't drain, and there was no water pressure some mornings (5th floor not the best place to be for that). I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Dirty hotel! A/C not working”
Reviews.Author: anghelus66
Reviews.Content: Hotel Internazionale ruined our longly planned vacation in Rome. Nevermind the noisy rooms, the rude personnel, etc The rooms are dirty, dusty, the furniture is very very old and rotten. the carpet is so old and humid, it gave my wife a very strong allergy. We complained immediately, but they said they had no room. in the evening we complained to another guy and he changed the room. So the first member of the staff lied to us! They new guy showed us 2 rooms. We picked one that seemed less dirty, but in the end was worse than the first one. The shower was not working as it was full with dirt. Water was almost cold. We complained again and again but for 3 days rhings were pretty much left like that. The air conditioning was so old and the filters were black as of the dust. When you turned on the air conditioning system, a bad odor came out. So most of the time we had to keep it off and imagine that in Rome they had like 38° Celsius! We tried to get another room in another hotel, but they had already charged us and wouldn't refund our money! So we were stuck in this half a star dump hotel! Beware! Avoid this hotel at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “I am still getting over the allergies from the smoke, mold, odors”
Reviews.Author: Irvinggetthecar
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the Hotel is in a good location, and the prices are reflective of a 3 star property, but.......The lobby is filthy dirty, old and dingy. This place needs to be cleaned! Some might call the deluxe room quaint? There was an odor from smoke and mold. I was there for just one night and am suffering still from the allergies. The room was quiet, and the bathroom somewhat updated. IT is true that for the price you get a 3 starish hotel. It was just a shock to me to spend 20 hours at this property. I would not recommend it to anyone traveling to Rome. At some point this property will undergo a multi million Euro renovation. The prices will double, the location will remain great, and the property will be very special. The staff were pleasant . But they were pushing those organized on off bus tours,but neglected to tell us that we could book a reservation for the Vatican on line and print out the entrance ticket, take a taxi there and back and do it for far less then the organized tourist bus. They do offer free WIFI and that was a big bonus. Please clean your lobby and the carpeting, and please offer smoke free rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage”
Reviews.Author: Jackietraveler
Reviews.Content: Vintage hotel located a block from Spanish steps. The hotel has a lot of character and history, but traveler must be careful what room is assigned. We asked to be moved from first room, which while large, was dark and depressing and hot. We were moved to spacious room, more open room with terrace which would have been lovely except for the record hot month in July - the AC never cooled the room. Baths in both rooms was modern and spacious, even offered a bidet. Our friends asked to be moved from their room, but were moved into a small room which was not much better than where they had been. Breakfast (included) was delicious and offered a large variety. Check out the hotel -it has lots of history and beautiful rooftop terrace. We enjoyed drinks in the bar after spending the day out in the hot weather in the beautiful city.. only recommend hotel in cooler months

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a disappointment ....”
Reviews.Author: ALITCHICK
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful (except for one concierge smoking at the desk and sometimes watching TV in the next room when guests required assistance); however, this did not make up for the shabby accommodations. The location is great! Minutes from the Spanish Steps, twenty minutes from the Trevi Fountain, perhaps thirty from the Pantheon. The room is quite dark at night and quietly situated (which we appreciate). It also has a great little terrace but due to the heat we were unable to use it much. Breakfast is very lovely with a good mix of foods and excellent service in a pleasant room (probably the best in the hotel). The reception area is depressing with dirty carpets and worn furniture. None of the photos on-line are representative of the true state of the hotel which was described as "elegant". The hotel is an odd configuration of rooms ... reflecting the fact that it was once (I believe) a convent and chapel. The elevator fits perhaps four people very tightly packed together. The air con was very poor (we were on the third floor). The shower handle was broken (and couldn't be adjusted) as was the toilet seat although it appeared as if the bathroom had been newly renovated and was very nicely done in new tile and fixtures. Blankets were coarse, furniture shabby, refrigerator dating back perhaps twenty years. We would not come back. Love love love Rome, this place ... not so much

Reviews.Title: “Warning: This is a DANGEROUS hotel”
Reviews.Author: avanbrug
Reviews.Content: Apart from beeing overpriced, and having smoke-smelling outdated rooms, i discovered that this hotel is verry dangerous in case of a fire. One evening i wanted to take some fresh air on the roof terrace. To my amazement i discovered that the only evacuationdoor to the roofterrace was firmly locked with a hanging lock! No key to be found. Also some of the the evacuationsigns in the hallways that are suppose to guide peoples to exits in case of a fire, pointed in the direction of this closed door! In case of a fire the guests are locked in like rats in a rattrap! In the daytime the door to the roofterrace is open, they even serve drinks etc. on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but fine in superior room”
Reviews.Author: issel
Reviews.Content: We were in Hotel Internazionale in Rome for 3 nights early June. We had a superior room in the 4th florr with roof terrace. The room was equipped with mini-bar and flat TV. The signal quality by the way was miserable, but we did not watch very much TV. The terrace was beautifull and even bigger than the room. The room was completly quiet (as it was located on the back side off the street) and you could darken the room very well to sleep longer than sunrise. Staff was quite polite and gave hints for sight seeing, motorcycle rental and so on. The hotel is a 100 meters away from the "spanish stair". It is also close to the Metro. If you come from the airport, it will cost you 15 Euros per person by train and metro. Consider that you have to walk a lot by changing from train to Metro. A taxi from the hotel to the airport was 45 Euros for 2 persons. More expensive, bit a bit sight seeing and less sweat... There are some restaurants nearby where you get pizza for about 10 Euros (but beer will cost 6 Euros, so it*s adding up...). We had no breakfast, thus I cannot tell you whether it*s worth 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: munchkin021
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and the staff very friendly but the decor needed some tender loving care to make it the 4 star it was rated as. We arrived in a storm - they upgraded us to a terrace room with spa bath. Unfortunately the spa bath didn't work and the rain was leaking in through the ceiling so we had to put a bowl on the floor to catch the monsoon rains! Again the room looked slightly more "weathered " than we think was intended and needed a very good clean. The hotel is not wonderfully situated as although it is near the Spanish Steps it still seemed to be a good walk to the nightlife. The hotel food was very good - better than in some of the places we ate in! Overall a nice hotel but slightly overpriced - probably not great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, no unpleasent surprices”
Reviews.Author: Athens13
Reviews.Content: Clean small rooms, friendly people at the reception, nice breakfast no extra charges or any of that unpleasent surprices everything went smooth

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Andynnj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the heat wave in Aug 09. It's a charming historic building and the location is convenient to almost anything you want to see in Rome. The woman at the front desk was always helpful, which is very nice, especially when it's your first visit to a city. The price we paid was reasonable and the room was huge (looked like a suite for parents and children) and the decor and furniture was beautiful. The only negative things I could point out are the granite-slab mattress (typical in Europe) and the condition of the bathroom - it was clean, but desperately needs repairs and the mold on the ceiling taken care of. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbk555
Reviews.Content: My visit to Rome was 9/29 – 10/3/09, a wonderful time of year. Hotel Internazionale was the perfect place to stay. The location, room, roof terrace, and breakfast were all wonderful. But the real reason I’m writing this review is to let you know of the incredible honesty of the staff at this hotel. I left a pair of earrings in the desk drawer of my room, gold loops with little diamonds on them, given to me by my late husband, so there was both a monetary and a sentimental value to them. I called the hotel from Florence when I realized that I’d left them. The wonderful staff at Hotel Internazionale took the time to find my earrings and package them up and ship them to me. I am so grateful to the staff and management at this lovely hotel. I will definitely stay there during my next stay in Rome. Mille grazie!

Reviews.Title: “This place is a bad deal !!”
Reviews.Author: dfkmd
Reviews.Content: When the reservation was made, it was for a specific accommodation which was paid in advance(3rd or 4th floor with a balcony). When we arrived we were told that "oh thats just a request" despite the contract which was printed! We were placed in a cell like room with no windows and a nonfunctioning shower. The hotel was well aware of this defect in the shower (which resulted in a bathroom flood)but mentioned nothing when placing us in this room. After three days and much anger and angst our room was changed to what we should have had in the 1st place. This room was average at best. Our overall experience was very poor which really put a damper on our 7 day trip to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel & incredible city!”
Reviews.Author: m_jones24668
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three days. It has been a very pleasant experience. We were greeted warmly and during all our stay all the staff was kind and helpful. We appreciated very much the suggestions the reception gave us for the tours: the hotel organizes personal tours of the city! The room we checked in was very nice and clean and breakfast was rich and excellent. The hotel is in the center of Rome, walking distance to nearly everything; in any case, if you do not want to walk you can find 2 metro stops very close to the hotel. We really had a fantastic vacation and we surely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: uaflier
Reviews.Content: I am so glad that we decided to stay here! The location of this hotel is fantastic. Virtually at the top of the Spanish steps, a 1 minute walk. You have the 5 star hotels as neighbours...The breakfast was the best in our travels in Italy..Cold cuts, fruit, bacon and eggs, yoghurt, breads, cappucino etc......Just perfect.. Rooms were sparsley decorated but big and in excellent condition. Airconditioning was on all day. The roof top terrace was a bonus, you could easily spend a couple of hours up there and read or sunbake..A big bonus was the FREE internet near reception..Would I stay again. You bet, a great gem of a hotel in beautiful Rome..This hotel should really be up in the top 20 of Rome!Can not speak highly enough of this place. Also if you only have a small amount of luggage you could take the train from FCO to Termini, catch the metro to Spanish steps take the lift up to Via Sistina and walk 1 minute and you are at the hotel. just a small tip, very easy and CHEAP way!

Reviews.Title: “horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: lovl
Reviews.Content: THE PICTURES ON THE INTERNET ARE DEFINATELY MISLEADING! Honestly, I recomend to see your room in person before making a reservation. After an exausting 8 hour flight from the states, we pulled into this hotel hoping for the pictures we saw on the internet; a hotel that had old charm but had modern upgrades. When we firsted walked in front of the hotel we couldn't even find the door because the door man wasn't even present. when we saw the clothes that the doorman was wearing, we presumed that the hotel wasn't in the best shape. The hotel's foyer is the size of a small minivan and all there is is two chairs to sit on. After taking a trip up the TINY elevator, we reached a dark hallway. We saw our room and it looked like a dump. The air conditionar was roaring and we couldn't hear a thing. The carpets were dirty and the entire room was filty, plus our room was so small. After we asked to upgrade our room, we waited 3 hours to see a room of higher quality. while we waited the conceirage went on and on about how it was superior and it was modern. We looked at this "superior" suite and it was far from superior. The room had water stains and it wasn't luxurious at all. The staff was nice, but they didn't really make a great attempt to pleasae us. A fabulous hotel nearby is the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again - overall, pleased”
Reviews.Author: Memphis_Meggle
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and I knew nothing about the city in terms of where I would want to go, etc. My husband made all the arrangements for this trip as it was a surprise for my birthday. The hotel location was actually rather inconvenient for him - he was attending a conference for 3 days of our trip - but he wanted the location to be good for us overall. It was. Hotel Internazionale is just yards away from the top of the Spanish Steps - and therefore a Metro train station stop. Other places looked farther away on a map than they really were. LOTS of places are within walking distance, including a really good coffee bar and a Blue Ice gelato store. :) The hotel staff was, in general, exceptionally nice and helpful. The gentleman who worked the overnight shift did not speak English as well as the daytime staff, nor was he as polite and friendly... but he was still decent, not rude or anything. The daytime staff was absolutely wonderful. Housekeeping did a fantastic job as well. They never barged in or bothered us, but whenever we came back after being gone for a while the room was in perfect order. They even left me a couple extra hotel pens when I left them a note requesting them. :) The room itself was very nice. Very spacious for a European room, from what I've been told. The closet had plenty of room and included a mini bar/fridge and a safe. The bathroom had a double sink vanity, and even a bidet! There was a desk with chair, and also a small loveseat. The room also came with a tv (reception was poor but tolerable) and a radio. A window in the bedroom area, and a second one in the bathroom, looked out into a private courtyard area. It was nice being able to open the windows and get fresh air but not have to worry about people looking into our room. The air conditioner/thermostat was a bit finicky but after about 2 days we got it to do what we wanted! The mattress on the bed was a bit firm for my personal taste, and the pillows were a bit TOO mushy, but I managed to sleep ok anyway. The hotel offers breakfast every morning until 10 a.m. in a designated room. The room is closed after 10 a.m. so it took us a few minutes to figure out exactly where it was, but we eventually found it. Don't go in barefoot, though! I got kicked out for trying to just walk downstairs and eat breakfast with no shoes on one morning. Whoops. The food is the Italian equivalent of a continental breakfast - eggs, bacon, various pastries and cereals, with some cheeses and meats also offered. Coffee is included; juices have an extra charge. You can get the breakfast brought to your room, or enjoy it on the hotel's 4th floor garden balcony, for an additional fee. We chose to just eat in the breakfast area for free and it was fine. Room service is offered but we did not utilize it so I can't comment on that. There is also a small snack bar/bar just off the lobby. It was closed every time we came back to the hotel at night so I can't comment on that, either. The hotel does have wireless internet access. We were told that it would not work in our room - that we'd have to go down to the access area in the lobby - but that turned out to be incorrect. The wireless signal worked just fine in our room. There is a computer available for public use in the lobby area, and it has a printer attached, so that is helpful if you want to print a map or a boarding pass. If and when we return to Rome we will probably stay somewhere else just because there are SO MANY nice hotels to choose from, but Hotel Internazionale served us well and was a great value overall. We really have nothing bad to say about it. The location was fantastic, the staff was polite and helpful, the room and public areas of the hotel were all clean, and everything worked as it should have. And the price fit our budget.

Reviews.Title: “An Italian Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gregg1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is strategically placed within 2 minutes walk from the top of the Spanish Steps. It is also in close proximity to excellent restaurants and shopping. The hotel rooms themselves (and we booked two rooms) are well renovated, spacious and with excellent bathroom facilties. The service was overwhelming good and the staff very attentive. The breakfast served were exceptional, generous and varied - five stars from us!

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: favarabrighton
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel before i read a lot of reviews somenot so kind.so it was a great surprise to find such a great hotel. first , it is an older place,though renovated recently. the room was great, large , clean and almost regal. the bathroom large and clean with a great shower.even facing the street ,the room was quiet. the breakfast was plentiful and good.the staff was very helpful and freindly throughout my stay. would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: DNigliazzo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 Night stay in Rome with the Hotel Internazionale. We had booked with another hotel but found out it was in a bad area so rebook this hotel through Last Minute.Com. We were not dissappointed. The room was a triple which came with it own private garden, which blew us away it was so nice. The bathroom was clean and modern with bath robe,slippers and all toiletries provided. The customer service was always polite and quick to respond. Every time we came in or out of the hotel we were always greeted with a hello or goodbye. The breakfast was really nice with everything you needed, even bacon and egg if you wanted to pay extra. The location was just perfect, 30 second walk from the Spanish Steps and about 20 min walk to Vatican.On the whole we were extremely pleased with our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: hmpDenmark
Reviews.Content: At the top of The Spanish Steps, you'll find Hotel Internazionale, so the location is great. Everything is within walking distance. The building is old and very charming. Though an "overall" repair is needed as it looks pretty worn out. The place was very clean, our rom was large for a classic double room with a large bathroom and the furniture has an antic look. We had heard that breakfast in Italy is terrible, but at this hotel we were nicely surpriced. There is a large breakfast buffet with anything you'd like. So if you want a charming place with at great location and a historic touch, hotel Internazionale will be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting horrible worst hotel we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: natski81
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful 3 week self drive holiday around Italy. My daughter booked all our hotels through recommendations on trip advisor, except for Hotel Internazionale(which was recommended by a family friend.) It was the worst experience we have ever had.Honestly we cannot understand how people are actually giving this place good reviews. Our pictures speak a thousand words. The rooms are filthy, stained carpets, water damaged walls, around 30 years worth of dust on the furniture and curtains. Paying 220 euro a night you would expect a moderate place, but seriously this place is the pits. The staff are useless. My husband had a fight with the staff as soon as we got there and demanded a room change. Our initial room was no bigger than a closet, and had no hot water(it took 30 minutes for the hot water to come through in a trickle enough for one person to have a very quick shower). They finally changed us to what they describe as their superior room. Judging by the photos i would hardly call it superior.It borders on backpacker budget. The breakfast is horrible. We contemplated changing hotels but it was our last stop before heading home and we were exhausted. However looking back now, we wished we had changed. There was a gorgeus little hotel around the corner called Hotel Homs, where we would have coffe every morning(and even breakfasts after experiencing the Internazionale's breakfast). We were only there 3 days and the waitress would recognise us and know exactly what we wanted at the Hotel Homs. It is miles ahead of the internationale, and we even enquired about the cost of the room and it would have only been 200 euro. The bed was broken, we couldnt even move around without the thought that we may fall off.The only small positive is its location right at the top of the spanish steps. We have stayed at some fairly average hotels, but honestly this is by far the worst experience we have ever had.They really tarnish a very nice city. Do yourself a favour and stay away.

Reviews.Title: “A good word for Hotel Internazionale”
Reviews.Author: yankeesman714
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Internazionale for 4 nights and I wanted to put in a good word for this place. The staff was excellent and the service was great. The rooms were spacious and the location was very convenient to everywhere we wanted to visit. The free breakfast was very good with lots of variety of fruits, cereals, breads, etc. The only negative which I must be honest about is that the air conditioning was not the greatest. We had to change rooms because the first room we had was simply too hot. But in all fairness, it was July in Rome and the temperature outside was above 90 degrees (Farenheit) everyday. I would still recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Hotel with an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LibbySanJose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Internazionale, Rome DATE: June 08 (4 night stay before our Mediterranean Cruise) REVIEWER: Olivia, San Jose, California My family and I stayed at this hotel in June of 08'. We had four rooms and each had it's own charm. Americans need to remember we are in Rome, the Romans do not sweat the small stuff. The rooms were clean, and a good place to rest in the middle (because it is very warm), and end of the day. I loved opening the shutter each morning and seeing the Italians go to work. Sometimes people would wave at me as they road their little motorbikes down the street. I loved the location. This hotel is right on top of the Spanish Steps. In the middle of everything. The location, and it's surroundings were very clean. Everything you want. I must say, the best cappuccino I've ever had is in this hotel. Not to mention 4 doors down the street the best gelato. You could walk to nice restraurants, theatres, the red and white bus, Phanthom, Trevi Fountain, etc., so much to see. Back to the hotel, The staff was very kind and helpful. Staff had good suggestions on dinner, and was helpful when we had question about public transportation. The breakfast was excellent. Each room had it's own restroom, but the shower in my room was small. But, it was clean. TVs are outdated, but you really don't need to watch one in Rome. There is a bar and an outside seating area. The hotel is a little rustic, but again the cleaness is more important to us. Would I stay here again, yes. No doubt. Four days in Rome is not enough, I need two weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Good Location and Breakfast, Okay Service”
Reviews.Author: mreogh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family over new years. The rooms were quite small for the price and a bit dark. Otherwise they were pleasant enough. The breakfast was excellent. The location is basically just above the Spanish Steps, meaning that it's right near the Villa Borghese Gardens, which is nice, but not that close to other points of interest. Overall it's a decent enough place to stay, but a bit of the expensive side considering the size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....but better choices around the corner”
Reviews.Author: walkpl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends in October. I found the hotel somewhat dirty. Front desk was not at all helpful. My room was so small I had to crawl over my husband to get to my side of the bed....maybe 1 ft on either side to the wall. In the bathroom you could sit on the toilet and brush your teeth at the same time....and if you dropped the soap in the shower you had to turn the water off and open the shower door in order to bend over and get the soap. Some of my friends rooms were larger but not much. Heat didn't work and we couldn't close the window so at night we were both cold and it was noisy. Breakfast room was about the only highlight in this hotel. This place is in bad need of help. There is a delightful new place just around the corner called Albergo Ottocento. Wish we had stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location w/ character and charm”
Reviews.Author: drphibes
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 6 nights during part of our honeymoon in Italy and had a wonderful time. The Internazionale has reasonable rates and an extraordinarily convenient location just about a half-block from the top of the Spanish Steps and very close to the Spagna Metro stop. It's a very safe area, and the hotel is a perfect base camp to explore the streets, cafes and sights of Rome. The staff were very friendly and helpful -- all spoke English, as most everyone seems to in Rome. The (included) breakfast each morning is quite nice and served in a beautiful room and setting. Our rooms (double superior rooms w/ terraces) were extremely quiet, clean and comfortable. Not a super-luxury hotel (and not nearly as expensive), but a comfortable, interesting boutique hotel with lots of character, history and charm. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use it”
Reviews.Author: familyinfo
Reviews.Content: This place is badly in need of refurbishment. location is great, but. ??????? rooms are not clean, TVs are older than my children and smaller than I have seen in years, and did not work well. Showers overflowed because of drains being slow or blocked. Noisy on street side. we were in 3 different rooms and looked at 2 others. we finally setteled on one it was so small i could lay in bed and almost touch both walls.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: Location! Location! Location! The top of the Spanish Steps is an excellent place to be. Breakfast OK; room was large enough; most of the staff were great. Two negatives: bathroom had a stale odor (not the room) and one desk clerk was pretty gruff.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience at the Internazionale!”
Reviews.Author: IsraelYossiR_
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Internazionale. As soon as we arrived in Rome we waited 2 hours at Fiumicino Airport for or luggage but with no success! Once we reached the Hotel all the desk staff was very helpful with us...they managed to have informations from the Airport Staff and finaly the next morning the luggage was delivered to the Internazionale. The hotel is in a perfect location for a tourist, in the center of the city just few steps from the main sites such as the Spanish Steps and the Trevi's Fountain. Our room was nice and clean with air conditioning and free wireless internet connection. We had our breakfast served on the roof terrace where we enjoyed a wonderful view of the city. Overall a very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: BB-HD
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the ALBERGO INTERNAZIONALE HOTEL. The service was terrible! The staff was not willing to help with anything. The breakfast was fair, the shower was broken, and the room did not feel clean. Do not recommend unless you want to stay because of the location...

Reviews.Title: “Short break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DawnMacclesfield
Reviews.Content: (couple 33, 34) Stayed in the Hotel Internazionale for 4 nights 30th Jun - 4th July. Booked via Venere.com after trawling many sites and hotels. We decided on the Internationale as it was central and reasonably priced. We were a little concerned as we didn't see that many reviews for the hotel and those we did, were ok. We booked a double superior room at 230 euros per night. We took the leanardo shuttle train straight from the aiport into the center of Rome - only 30 minute on a direct train. Very easy. From the termini station in Rome we took a taxi as it looked a fair walk from the station and we had a large case. Taxi cost 5 euros. We were able to check in to the hotel early as the room was ready. We were given room 27. Upon entering the room I was disappointed. We were given a room at the back of the hotel that was looking onto an atrium rather than the street. Due to this the room was very dark with no natural light coming in the windows. Once our eyes settled to the darkness and we turned all the lights on we were happier with the room. The sheets and towels were clean and bed comfy. The only downside was the room could have been given a little tlc. The edges of the carpets were frayed, the skirting boards were loose from the walls and the paint work needed touched up. The bathroom was large but the walls were a little mouldy - a lick of paint would have sorted it out. If we left the main lights off you wouldn't notice any of these things. The room had a mini bar that had plenty room for us to store our own water and wine - save on the hotel prices. Breakfast was included in our rate and we went only once to the dinning room. Standard continential breakfast with cereal, fruits, ham, cheese etc. If you wanted eggs you were expected to pay anything from 3 euros up. The hotel as a lovely terrace on top of the hotel that you can take breakfast on for 10euro a head - bit pricey but view is lovely. We went up to the terrace after a day out sight seeing and the view was stunning. We thought that had they had a bar on that floor it would have been complete. Overall the hotel was ok. When in Rome you are only needed a place to sleep and this did the trick. Rome itself is lovely. Everything is walking distance. The hotel is about 50 yards from the top of the Spanish steps - perfect location. We eat out every night and found some wonderful restaurants. Try the local ice cream for an after dinner treat.

Reviews.Title: “129 Euro laundry bill and a bad room.”
Reviews.Author: stevesf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Internazionale for 3 nights on our honeymoon trip in Italy . We had just come from a fanless apartment and punishing heat in Florence and were looking forward to a nice hotel room with air conditioning. The lobby was cool, but when we entered our room, the AC was running, but it seemed hotter than it was outside. The AC ran the whole time, but it was always uncomfortably hot in the room. The room itself was also pretty run down. On the first day, we needed to do laundry. There were no prices on the checklist in the room, so I called the main desk and they did not have a price list, so I took a leap of faith and the laundry we did in Florence for for 8 euros cost us 129 at the hotel! I was pretty upset to see this at checkout, so I asked for the price list again and they still couldn't come up with one. At our next hotel, their price list confirmed that each item was on average about 5 euros, so I would recommend doing your laundry outside the hotel at all costs, but that doesn't really excuse them not having a price list. The only saving grace for this hotel, is that is probably the cheapest hotel that is within a block of the Spanish Steps, but not really worth the 250 euro/night charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Henny&Roth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at this hotel. From the time we arrived till checkout we could not have requested much more. The desk was extremely helpful with directions and spoke very good English so we were able to communicate with very little difficulty. The central location made is easy to get around to the historic places and the metro was also very close. The staff helped us to begin our adventures throughout Rome. The breakfast was a good start to the day and the attendant added to the ambience. The hotel also had free internet in the lobby. The personnel, Alessandaro and Daria (at the main desk), were extremely good at giving out suggestions for things to do and a route to take daily. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to travelers in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: lparker2
Reviews.Content: Rome was the final destination of our 25th annivesary trip to Italy and was our dream trip for many years. We were looking for a nice hotel, well priced, and in a great location and this fit all categories. In addition, we contacted the staff prior to our arrival to help us arrange for private guides and tours and they did a fabulous job there as well. The rooms are lovely, nice decor, and large (for Europe's standards) and most importantly was the location -- walking distance to nearly everything. Have already recommended it to family and friends and we would definately return here on our next adventure to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: yankee75
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 wonderful days and all of us enjoyed it very much. The hotel is very well located, very close to important places to see in Rome, and it is very easy to get to because the metro is not far. We were checked in a very large room with a beautiful view and a great bed. The bathroom was very clean with a nice jacuzzi tub and a shower. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful. If ever in Rome I suggest this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mry76
Reviews.Content: From the first day I arrived at the hotel til the day I left everyting was perfect. The room was very clean and quiet which was just what I needed, the food excellent and very rich, the staff helpful in every need I had. The location of the hotel is great, very close to many touristic atractions. I recommand Hotel Internazionale to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't come back...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel months before. We asked for a beautiful room and we received a very small room, with no view. Breakfast was poor, almost no services in the hotel. If you want to use internet you have to pay. We have already paid 400 usd a night, they asked 5 euro for 30 minutes of internet! We've seen other places, nicer at lower places. We'd never come back!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I suffered a book-out from another Hotel nearby and was sent at the Internazionale…what a great Hotel! Everything was simply fantastic, the Staff, the room (maybe a bit small), the location…THE BREAKFAST (never found a three star Hotel with such a buffet!). The only problem is the street noise at the first floor…ask for a room at the top floors or in the back of the Hotel. Thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it! No room at our arrival!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've reserved a beautiful room at this hoel 6 month before! I was coming for my honeymoon with my husband, so I asked for a beautiful room paying almost 300 euros for the room per night. When we arrived the car at the airport wasn't there. We came in taxi to the hotel and at the arrival they told us that for the first night we had to go to another hotel (not even a hotel a bed & Breakfast) , the second night in another hotel and only the remaining 5 nights we would have stayed in Albergo Internazionale. We refused everything, took the lugagge and found ourselves another hotel. The surprise was, that when we got home, we realized that they charged us 2 nights(!!!) for nothing! Want a piece of advice: better avoid this hotel, you may have a big surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at hotel Internazionale. The hotel situated just a few step from Spanish Step. We walked to countdown there. Breakfast room is nice. The rooms need a bit of updated. Mr. Giorgio - front desk - is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: dmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Internazionale for 4 days in August. I had been trying without luck for some info on this hotel on tripadvisor, but was never able to find anything current. The hotel is located at the top of the Spanish Steps, on via sistina, which runs parallel to the top of the Spanish Steps. The hotel at the top is the Hassler; on the same block is the Intercontinental, then the Internazionale. So the location is ideal. We could walk everywhere. We went with another family and I have 3 kids. The other family has 2 young boys. They stayed in room 34, which was very nice---high ceilings, lots of charm and a working air conditioner. This room faces the street on the 3rd floor. My husband and I split up because of the 3 kids. My daughter and I stayed in room 34, which was also nice, faced the street and had a good air conditioner, but was in desperate need of paint. There was no dresser, just a 60's style wardrobe. It had high ceilings, wood floors and a beautiful old rug. The walls needed work. Overall I liked the room for it's charm. My husband, on the other hand, had a triple--a room facing the courtyard. It had a nice patio, BUT it was hot. The air conditioner was old and could not cool the room. Although this was August, it rained and was only in the 80's during the hottest times. His room was also on the 3rd floor---room 40. My husband found it old and outdated. I was originally given room 35, but moved because the air conditioner did not cool the room. My husband moved to room 24, because we thought it would be just like the room above it where our friends were staying. Unfortunately, the air con. was in the hall and didn't come close to cooling the large room. So, my friend, who is italian, talked the hotel into upgrading him to the suite on the 4th floor. The suite, the only one the hotel has, is two bedrooms with a bathroom between them. It's more like two connecting rooms. It also faced the courtyard. It had two air conditioners, which also couldn't keep up with the heat. My husband thought maybe because it was on the 4th floor (the top floor). The whole hotel needs updating. The walls need paint, the furniture is 60s in some rooms and nice in others. The beds are firm. The bathrooms are adequate. The rooms are all very very dark. All the rooms I saw (and there were a lot!) were large. The ceilings are high. The rooms are all different. The hallways are old and tired. They have a beautiful old staircase which is roped off. The staircase they use is rather unattractive. The lobby is 60's, 70's. The hotel has great bones, but needs work. If they fixed it up, I'm sure they could get $400 - $500 a night. It could be just great with all of it's old world charm and a great location. It is not at all luxurious in any way. I'm a light sleeper and never had a problem with noise. I wouldn't stay below the breakfast area (3rd floor facing the courtyard). The breakfasts were good. The service was also good. The air conditioning was a big issue. If the weather had been hot, even in the 90's, I think we may have had to move hotels--although my room was fine. The majority of the rooms were not fine. So, my experience was different than my husband's. I hate Hiltons and large hotels with no charm. I felt like I was in Italy. I would stay here again, but I don't think my husband would. If you do decide to stay here, ask for the 3rd floor, away from the breakfast area. Ask for a room with a new air conditioner (the new ones are white, the old ones are beige), ask for a street view--they are more charming, less noisy and more updated.(--Although I thought room 40 was very charming--but right across from breakfast and the A/C didn't really work.) And I loved room 34, but it was a quad. We were gone for a month and ended our trip at the Airport Hilton in Rome. My kids thought it was 10 times more luxurious than the Internazionale. This was our first trip to Rome so I have nothing to compare it to. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Hotel Internazionale Top of Spanish Steps--close to all WOnderful historic hotel-great breakfast included patios on most units & terrace overlooking the city had a guide-=expensive but worth every penny for 4 hours-saw more than if I had tried to do it alone & was able to get to the beginning of line @ the Vatican Tony POma--06 7225085 also took a shuttle from the airport instead of a taxi look for booth booking hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best location & price in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: dcherub
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Internazionale 6 times! The location at the top of the Spanish Steps is perfect! The staff (especially Elena & Giorgio) were all very helpful & attentive. They always make sure to honor my room request (back of hotel with private terrace). It is lovely & quiet...The rooms are air conditioned, have great bathrooms, and lots of amenities! The breakfast room is beautiful, & they serve a wonderful buffet. The rooftop terrace overlooking Rome is delightful for an afternoon cocktail. We shall always stay here when in Rome! Grazie Andrea & staff! Arrivederci! Dana Cherubini

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Internazionale, which accomodated us after a snafu with our original hotel. The Internazionale is in a great location, right at the top of the Spanish Steps. We walked everywhere in Rome with no problem! Yes, it is noisy. We had a room facing the street, with our own private terrace on the 4th floor. We didn't hear any of the breakfast noise, or the other rooms, but the sounds of the street, the cars, the crowds, were loud. the hotel provides ear plugs to help that problem. The bathroom was clean and a good size. The room was tiny and the bed was hard, but overall it was a good value for the location.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Internazionale
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sistina 79, 00187 Rome, Italy
